Data: Gillespie to Hayden, no run short of a length and defended back to the bowler
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run short and hayden pulls it straight to deep midwicket, extra protection at the boundary
Gillespie to Haddin, no run back of a length putside off, pushed towards covers
Gillespie to Haddin, FOUR runs back of a length again and Haddin picks the length early and swings with his bottom hand, the ball sails over midwicket
Gillespie to Haddin, FOUR runs the off side this time! overpitched on off stump and Haddin pierces the packed off side field
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run quick single taken towards mid-off, ball hits the stumps, Haddin dives but the third umpire rukes in the batsman's favour
Bond to Haddin, no run
Bond to Haddin, no run pitched on the channel outside off, swinging away, left alone
Bond to Haddin, no run slightly wider outside off stump, left alone to McCullum watchfully
Bond to Haddin, no run dug in short of a length closer to off stump, left alone
Bond to Haddin, no run Bond drops this one fuller, Haddin gets on the backfoot and defends
Bond to Haddin, no run attempted inswinging yorker, Haddin digs it out and the ball hads towards point
Gillespie to Hayden, no run pitched on a length outside off, not much movement after pitching. left alone

Gillespie to Hayden, OUT Gillespie has the last laugh! pitched up on off stump, Hayden steps down, gives himself some room to swish it over the off side, fails to get the desired elevation and hits it to Vettori at mid-off who takes it low
Gillespie to Hussey, no run Hussey is greeted first up with a short of length delivery on off stump, left alone
Gillespie to Hussey, no run defended back to the bowler
Gillespie to Hussey, no run short of a length on middle, Hussey turns his wrists and turns it towards square leg
Gillespie to Hussey, no run Hussey places it on the off side and cuts it to point
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run good work by Vincent at point, Haddin gets forwrd to a short of a length ball, CVincent flings himself to his right, aims at the non strikers end but the throw was too high
Tuffey to Hussey, no run watchfully left alone
Tuffey to Hussey, 2 runs misfield at point, Gillepie at the deep throws it to the non strikers end and the ball strikes Hussey while he makes his ground
Tuffey to Hussey, 3 runs drive through covers, good timing by Hussey
Tuffey to Haddin, no run
Tuffey to Haddin, no run better line by Hussey, pitches it closer to the batsman, Haddin gets back and defends on the off side
Gillespie to Hussey, no run short, Gillespie hulrs it in with good pace, Hussey defends on the backfoot
Gillespie to Hussey, no run slightly fuller, shaping across the left hander, Hussey pushes it towards point
Gillespie to Hussey, no run good length on middle and off stump, defended back to the bowler
Gillespie to Hussey, no run holds the length back a little, Hussey gets forward and triesd to work it past the off side, pushes it towwards point again
Gillespie to Hussey, no run similar length, Hussey doesnt get enough room to steer it past the off side, defends to point again
Gillespie to Hussey, no run fuller and Hussey tries to drive it straight, mistimes it as the ball gets the inner half the bat and rolls back to the bowler
Tuffey to Haddin, no run loosener, pitches outside off, Haddin defends towards point
Tuffey to Haddin, no run lapse in co0ncentration! Tuffey digs it in short as Haddin advances, misses it completely
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run fuller and turned towards midwicket
Tuffey to Hussey, no run pitched closer to the batsman at a good length, Hussey gets forward and defends

Tuffey to Hussey, no run full on middle and off stump, Tuffey leans forward to drive but doesn't time it well enough, mid-off picks it up
Gillespie to Haddin, 2 runs well fielded at the deep backward point, Haddin backs away and slices a fullish delivery outside off, third man runs across to deep backward point and pulls it back
Gillespie to Haddin, no run digs it in a little short and Haddin swings and.....misses
Gillespie to Haddin, FOUR runs thundered past the bowler! full on off stump, Haddin hits it hard past the left of Gillespie who gets his hands towards the ball but it screams past him
Gillespie to Haddin, no run
Gillespie to Haddin, no run outside off stump, staright to Styris at extra cover
Gillespie to Haddin, no run swing and a miss, Haddin lucky not to get an edge
Tuffey to Hussey, FOUR runs pulled away in style! Hussey picks the length so early, uses his bottom hand and whips it over square leg
Tuffey to Hussey, 1 run pushed towards the off side
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run Tuffey aims at the blockhole on off stump, Haddin digs it out towards mid-on
Tuffey to Hussey, 1 leg bye slower ball, drifting on the pads, ball rolls towards fine leg
Tuffey to Haddin, FOUR runs another cracker! Haddin charges a short of a length delivery, beats the off side field, the ball steams past cover
Tuffey to Haddin, 1 run tries to do it again, the short ball catches Haddin on the hop, Haddin fortunately keeps it down, the ball rolls towards point
Gillespie to Haddin, no run pushed towards the on side
Gillespie to Haddin, no run Haddin charges down again, misses, was a little too short to play any strokes on the front foot
Gillespie to Haddin, 1 run short and pulled towards fine leg
Gillespie to Hussey, no run good length on middle and off, pushed towards cover

Tuffey to Hussey, no run slower and fuller, Hussey drives back to Tuffey who gets a hand to it, good stop
Tuffey to Hussey, SIX runs what a shot! Hussey advances and lofts elegantly straight over the bowlers head
Tuffey to Hussey, 1 run drifting on the pads and Hussey turns it away towards square leg

Tuffey to Hussey, 1 run drifting on the pads, ball clips the pad and rolls towards the on side
Gillespie to Hussey, no run Vincent at point again! Hussey gives himself room frees his arms but fails to pierce the off side field
Gillespie to Hussey, 1 run short of a length outside off, Hussey finds the gap past point this time
Gillespie to Haddin, no run Haddin hits it back to the bowler, cries of 'catch it' but it was a bump ball

Gillespie to Hussey, 1 run short of a length, slammed with force but straight to deep point
Gillespie to Haddin, no run
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run flat on off stump, Hussey steers it to point

Vettori to Haddin, no run pushed in just a little flatter, good drift, defended back to Vettori
Vettori to Haddin, no run tossed up outside off, Haddin tries to dab it past third man, hits it to sjort third man and the single is refused
Vettori to Haddin, no run tossed up outside off, cut towards point
Styris to Hussey, 1 run punched off the backfoot to short cover, Taylor dives does well to stop that

Styris to Haddin, no run defended towards cover
Styris to Haddin, no run oof! Styris bowls that on middle and leg, Haddin swings, misses and the ball just misses the stumps

Vettori to Haddin, 1 run turned towards square leg for an easy single
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run tossed up on off and middle, Hussey gets forward and steers it to the gap wide point
Vettori to Haddin, no run flighted outside off, Haddin gets on the backfoot and gets o\an inside edge onto his pads,
Styris to Hussey, no run good length on off stump, cut towards point
Styris to Hussey, FOUR runs short of a lengthj, Hussey gets back and flat-bats it past the bowler, the ball goes steaming past the outfield
Styris to Hussey, 1 run
Styris to Haddin, 1 run Haddin gets on the frontfoot and drives uppishly towards long-on
Styris to Hussey, no run short of a length, Hussey punches o\it towards Taylor at cover who does well again to cut that off
Styris to Hussey, 1 run slightly short of a length punched towards covers
Vettori to Hussey, no run flatter and faster, Hussey defends towrds the of side
Vettori to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off, Hussey gives room to cut but misses

Vettori to Hodge, no run defended on the front foot, bit of pad, appeal by McCullum
Vettori to Hodge, 1 run flighted ball drifting on the pads, Hodge turns it towards square leg
McMillan to Hodge, 2 runs punched towards point, McCullum runs across, has a shy at the tumps at the non strikers end, hts the stumps but the batsman was home
McMillan to Hodge, FOUR runs drifting on the pads, Hodge scoops it easily towards deep midwicket
McMillan to Hodge, no run

McMillan to Hussey, no run short of a length on middle, cut to point

Vettori to Hodge, no run struck on the pads, outside the line

Styris to Hussey, 1 run
Styris to Hodge, no run spears this in on a good length on off, defended on the front foot

Styris to Hodge, no run defended towards mid-on

Vettori to Hodge, no run flatter delivery, defended on the front foot

Styris to Hodge, no run good length delivery, in the channel outside the off stump and Hodge is made to defend

Styris to Hodge, 1 run good line and length delivery, Hodge works it away towards square leg

Styris to Hussey, FOUR runs and the boundary turns it into another excellent over for New Zealand. Slightly short and on the middle and off stump line, pulled away in style to the wide long on fence. That's his fifty
Vettori to Hodge, no run defended down on the leg side
Vettori to Hodge, FOUR runs not that short but Hodge rocks back and cuts it away well wide of the fielder at gully, short boundary down there and third man had no chance of cutting it off
Vettori to Hodge, no run again cut away well but this time the ball goes straight to the fielder at point
Vettori to Hodge, no run tight delivery and Hodge plays it down on the leg side
Vettori to Hodge, no run line and length, Hodge defends it
Vettori to Hodge, 2 runs clipped away off the pads to deep midwicket, just enough room and they scamper through for the second
Gillespie to Hussey, FOUR runs take that! Hussey on the attack here - first ball of a new spell, Hussey dances down the track and swats it away to the wide long-on fence, that sets up the over

Gillespie to Hussey, no run just short of a length, Hussey once again comes down the track and swings hard but on this occasion the shot is not timed well enough and the ball rolls away off the inner half of that bat

Gillespie to Hussey, FOUR runs short ball and that's dispatched to the square leg fence, Gillespie pulled it back seeing Hussey come down the track, Hussey quickly picked up the length, rocked ball and pulled it away in style

Gillespie to Hussey, FOUR runs another short ball and this is turning into a nightmare over! Once again Hussey got right on top of the bounce and this time the ball raced away to the backward square leg fence. Kiwis are bleading...
Gillespie to Hussey, no run change of angle - bowled round the wicket and finally Gillespie manages to tie Hussey down
Gillespie to Hussey, no run just short of a length and coming in with the angle, Hussey on the back foot defending

Vettori to Hussey, 1 run clipped away off the back-foot to the backward square leg region
Vettori to Hodge, no run tossed up outside the off stump, defended stretching well forward
Vettori to Hodge, 1 run good length delivery, swept away through square leg for an easy single

McMillan to Hussey, 1 run worked away from wide outside the off stump to the square leg region

McMillan to Hodge, 1 run driven well wide of the fielder at mid-on
McMillan to Hussey, no run pitched up outside the off stump, driven hard but straight to the fielder at mid-off
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run good length delivery outside the off stump, Hussey waits for the ball and taps it away well wide of the fielder at cover. Early call and a quick single is added to the total
McMillan to Hodge, no run good delivery to end the over, no room offered and Hodge is made to defend. Just three runs off the over
Bond to Hussey, 1 run good length delivery on the middle and leg stump line, worked away through square leg for an easy single
Bond to Hodge, no run good length delivery, Hodge on the back foot defending

Bond to Hodge, no run short of a length and wide outside the off stump, that was because Bond saw Hodge coming down the track. In the end Hodge tried to cut it away through point but failed to make contact
Bond to Hodge, no run yorker length delivery outside the off stump and Hodge digs it out straight to the fielder at point
Bond to Hodge, 1 run just short of a length, no real width offered but Hodge steers it down to third man for an easy single
Bond to Hussey, 1 run full down leg side, Hussey stays back and clips it away behind square on the leg side
McMillan to Hussey, SIX runs take that! McMillan lobs it slow outside off, Hussey gets on one knee and lofts it over long-on
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run flatter from McMillan, Hussey sweeps it towqrds square leg

McMillan to Hussey, 1 run ful and outside off, driven down to long-off
Bond to Hussey, 1 run tip and run, Hussey plays it with soft hands, ball gets an inside edge onto the pads and rolls to the off side
Bond to Hodge, FOUR runs short, wide and despatched! Hodge cuts it away ferociously past point, sweet timing
Bond to Hodge, no run better line and length, defended back
Bond to Hodge, FOUR runs full and wide and slower, Hodge gets forward and sends the ball screeching past the covers
Bond to Hodge, 1 run plays with soft hands, dabs it down towards the off side and steals a single
Bond to Hussey, 1 run slower ball, Hussey leans forward and pushes it towards mid-off who is a little deep
Vincent to Hussey, no run not a bad start, good length on off stump, pushed to cover
Vincent to Hussey, 1 run fuller, pushed on the front foot past the bowler

Vincent to Hodge, no run pushed away towards point, a bit of a mixup but the single was turned down
Vincent to Hodge, no run hit straight to point, good over by Vincent
Vettori to Hussey, FOUR runs Reverse sweep! flat on middle, Hussey gets in position and finds the gap
Vettori to Hussey, no run pushed forcefully towards cover

Vettori to Hussey, 1 run flighted on off, Hussey gets to the pitch of it and pushes it to long-on on the walk
Vettori to Hodge, FOUR runs tossed up on off, Hodge stays at the crease and places it beautifully behind point, finds the gap to perfection
Vettori to Hodge, 1 run turned away towards the on side
Vincent to Hodge, 2 runs full toss, swinging in, Hodge slog sweeps it to deep midwicket
Vincent to Hodge, 1 run pushed towards midwicket for a single

Vincent to Hussey, SIX runs and another! similar delivery, Hussey hits this straighter, goes plenty of rows back
Vincent to Hussey, no run cut away towards point
Vincent to Hussey, SIX runs Hussey on fire! default mode again! Vincent lands it on a fullish length on middle and leg, Hussey gets on one knee and sweeps it over d\deep midwicket this time

Vettori to Hodge, 1 run cut away towards point
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run pushed in flatter towards leg, Hussey gets forward and turns to midwuicket
Vettori to Hodge, 1 run tries to bludh\geon this one over midwicket, doesnt time it right
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run reverse sweep again, but doesnt get the placement right
Vettori to Hodge, 1 run arm ball, Hodge throwns his bat at it, keeps it down and drives it to deep cover
McMillan to Hodge, no run Hodge gives room, drives to cover
McMillan to Hodge, 1 run full on middle and leg, Hodge swings across the line and midwicker does the fielding

McMillan to Hussey, OUT brilliant stuff! slower ball, Hussey gives room to play another slog sweep, plays too early, gets the top edge, the ball is in the air for a long time, Taylor runs in from long on, slides and takes it superbly just inches off the ground
McMillan to Hodge, 1 run full and on the pads, Hodge turns to deep midwicket

McMillan to Hodge, no run full and on the pads, turned away to the on side

Gillespie to Hodge, no run appeal! tried to scoop it over the keeper, the ball sneaks thorugh his legs, McCullum takes a catckh diving to his left, appeals, sees that the non striker was half way down the pitch then throws it to the non strikers end, misses

Gillespie to White, 2 runs lofted high behind the bowler, lands in the middle of nowhere

Bond to Hodge, no run yorker length outside off, backs away, misses it completely

Bond to Hodge, (no ball) beamer! that one slipped out and Bond apologises

McMillan to White, 1 run

Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run slower ball on leg, Hodge swings it towards deep midwicket
Tuffey to White, 1 run on the blockhole, White just digs it out and shoots off for a quick single, Tuffey runs towards the strikers end and attempts a run out
Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run reverse swing, dug out and played towards fine leg
Tuffey to White, 1 run fullish on the pads, played towards long on
Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run reverse swing again, Hodge backs away a little, swings scross the line, plays it to the on side
Tuffey to White, SIX runs and another easy six! Tuffey drops this on on a length, Hodge gets to the pitch and slogs it over deep midwicket, just the right length to play that stroke
Gillespie to Hodge, 1 run punched down to long-on
Gillespie to White, SIX runs going, gone! rank half volley on middle, White waits for it, connects and lofts it over the straight boundary
Gillespie to White, 1 run yorker on middle nd leg, White plays it to deep midwicket
Gillespie to Hodge, 1 run on the blockhole outside off, dug out to cover
Gillespie to White, 1 run on the blockhole outside off, dug out to long off
Gillespie to Hodge, 1 run yorker length on middle and leg, slogged along the ground to long-on
Tuffey to Hodge, 2 runs on the blockhole and dug out to deep midwicket
Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run slower ball, swinging towards the base of leg stump, gets an inside edge onto his boot and the ball rolls to the off side
Tuffey to White, FOUR runs drifting down the pads, fine leg in the circle and White turns it to the boundary, no chance of cutting that off
Tuffey to White, 1 run swinging in on middle and leg, turned to long leg
Tuffey to Hodge, 1 run yorker length outside off, Hodge throws the kitchen sink at it, fails to beat the infield, takes a single

Tuffey to White, FOUR runs straying in line again and Tuffey gets the punishment! drifting on the pads, White flicks his wrists and turns it to the fine leg boundary, this time finer than the first one in this over
For now you may read the lunch bulletin by Brydon Coverdale

He scored 10 fours and two sixes in his knock and his stand with White was worth a massive 84 off just 7.3 overs at a rate of 11.20 an over. A rude shock for the home side no doubt. The story so far has been of two of Australia's domestic warhorses who've had to wait years for the big break. Both scored at over

Hodge must be wondering what it takes to score a one-day ton! He was undefeated on 99 against the same side in the CB Series recently and now he falls three short of another well deserved ton. He wouldn't mind that too much though.
Seven off the first over...just what NZ need
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run good length on middle and off, Vuincent plays it off his pads to square leg
Bracken to Fleming, no run pacy delivery outside off, left alone safely
Bracken to Fleming, 2 runs overpitched outside off, Fleming leans onto it and the ball races past cover, good work by Jaques at the boundary
Bracken to Fleming, FOUR runs this one reaches the ropes! overpitched on the pads, Fleming gets forward and works it wide of mid-on
Bracken to Fleming, no run good length outsiode off, left alone to Haddin
Bracken to Fleming, no run good length outside off and shaping away just a tad, left alone safely again
McGrath to Vincent, no run good delivery to start off, on a length outside off, left alone
McGrath to Vincent, no run good length outside off, no away movement, Vincent lets it go
McGrath to Vincent, no run pitched on the corridor just outside off stump, Vincent gets behind the line and defends
McGrath to Vincent, no run pitches on a length just a little wide of off stump, no room to cut, left alone
McGrath to Vincent, 1 run good length delivery, dips in after pitching, Vincent shuffles a little across his stumps and works it across towards fine leg
McGrath to Fleming, 1 leg bye short of length on leg stump, gets on Fleming's thighs, he turns it towards the on side and takes a quick single
Bracken to Taylor, no run drifting down leg, ball clips the thigh pad on the way to Haddin
Bracken to Taylor, 1 run inside edge, bit of late swing for Bracken
Bracken to Vincent, no run Bracken hurls this one faster, pitches on a length outside off and swings away, left alone
Bracken to Vincent, no run fuller, Vincent gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
Bracken to Vincent, no run outside off stump and Vincent decides to do nothing with it, wise decision
McGrath to Taylor, no run beaten! McGrath holds the length back, Taylor tries to cut but doesnt move his feet
McGrath to Taylor, no run left alone, nearly gets the edge while sticking his bat out
McGrath to Taylor, 1 run short of a length, Taylor tries to turn to the leg side but gets an outside edge to third man
McGrath to Vincent, 2 runs short of a length outside off, opuched away off the backfoot, well timed, mid off does the fielding
McGrath to Vincent, no run pitched closer to the batsman, sticks his front foot out, hit on the pads
McGrath to Vincent, 2 runs good length outside off, Vincent opens the face of the bat and steers it to third man
Bracken to Taylor, 1 run pushed to mid-off, batsmen steal a run after the ball ricochets off the stumps
Bracken to Vincent, FOUR runs streaky, inside edge just misses the stumps and races to fine leg
Bracken to Vincent, no run swinging s\away, left alone
Bracken to Vincent, SIX runs take that! short of a length, Vincent uses his bottom hand and pulls it over square leg
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run tip and run, plays it with soft hands and drops it to the off side, good running
Bracken to Taylor, no run Bracken pushes this with more pace, draws Vincent on the front foot, defended
McGrath to Vincent, no run back of a length, comes in after pitching, left alone
McGrath to Vincent, 1 run good length, comes in, Vincent gets nicely behind it and dabs it towards cover and picks up a quick single
McGrath to Taylor, no run Taylor gets the full face of the bat down and defends
McGrath to Taylor, no run short, in the length to pull, Taylor swings but plays too early
McGrath to Taylor, 1 run dabbed to point, Taylor sets off and scampers home
McGrath to Vincent, 1 run good length, Vincent moves across his stumps and inside edges it towards fine leg
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run good length on middle, Taylor pushes it on the front foot to mid off, takes a single
Bracken to Taylor, no run comes forward to a good length delivery, defended to cover
Bracken to Taylor, 1 leg bye short of a length, shaping away, tries to heave it on the on-side, hit on the thigh pad
Bracken to Vincent, 1 run dropped towards mid-off with soft hands and another quick single
Bracken to Taylor, FOUR runs pushed past the covers! Bracken errs, overpitches, and Taylor times it well enough
Bracken to Taylor, no run good length on off stump. comes in just a tad, Taylor opens the face but doesnt find the gap, steered to point
Tait to Vincent, 1 run pacy delivery to start off with, 150 kmp/h, short and wide outside off, cut away to backward point
Tait to Taylor, 1 wide short, wide outside leg stump, Tait loses control over that
Tait to Taylor, 2 runs short of a length on middle, turned away wide of midwicket

McGrath to McCullum, FOUR runs that's it! yet another full toss! McCullum stays put, flicks it wth delectable ease over midwicket. scenes of jubilation at Eden Park! Fleming walks out onto the field, this is an emotional moment for him

All that's left now is a dead rubber at Seddon Park in Hamilton with New Zealand aiming for a clean-sweep and Australia looking to salvage their battered pride. It will be foolish to jump to conclusions on their fortunes in the World Cup. Once their big guns return, make no mistake, they will come back hard and

This is quite a stunning turn of events just before the World Cup. The world champions, riding on a crest not too long ago have drifted off course and the teams they tormented - England and New Zealand - have clawed back and evened the score. It was the self belief of New Zealand which saw them through, courtes
What an amazing win for the home side and with that they have taken the series 2-0 and have also managed to topple Australia from their No.1 spot in the ICC rankings. Have your say
New Zealand won by 5 wickets (with 8 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Ross Taylor, NZ
